Key Match Events: Shivam Dube made a punchy, unbeaten half-century that headlined India's successful chase of 159.
Jitesh Sharma impressed with 31 off 20 balls.
Axar Patel had Ibrahim Zadran caught at short cover in the ninth over and Rahmat Shah chopping on for 3 off 5 balls.
Washington Sundar did a decent job with a 13-run over in chilly conditions in the penultimate over of the innings.
Najibullah Zadran dragged Afghanistan to a competitive total with 19* off 15 balls.
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya was not mentioned but  India brushed Afghanistan aside in the first game in chilly Mohali.
India won by 6 wickets (with 15 balls remaining) and went 1-0 up in the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit Sharma had a low-key return to T20Is, run out for a duck in the first over of India's chase.
The match was played in chilly Mohali conditions that made it difficult for spinners to grip the ball.
Others: Gill wasn't even supposed to play this game due to a groin injury to Yashasvi Jaiswal.
Virat Kohli was unavailable for this match for personal reasons.
